revised_title: On the Variation of Pressure Developed during the Explosion of Cordite in Closed Vessels
tldr: The authors investigate the pressure developed during the explosion of cordite in closed vessels and find that the maximum pressure is proportional to the mass and volume of cordite used, and inversely proportional to the volume of the vessel. They also determine the time taken by the explosion and the rate of increase of pressure, which can be used to calculate the properties of modern explosives used in ballistics.
